rationale: First US-China sister state pairing. Both industrial heartlands.
Early post-normalization agreement.
Both densely populated coastal provinces with strong manufacturing.
Both major wheat/grain producers on flat fertile plains.
Shaanxi (陕西 capital Xi'an) distinct from Shanxi (山西).
Both major industrial centers with auto/manufacturing focus.
Both cold-climate agricultural powerhouses with dairy focus.
Historical 18th-century Canton trade connections.
Both agricultural giants. Xi Jinping visited Iowa from Hebei in 1985.
Both forested mountainous coastal regions with similar climates.
Heavy industry bases. IL opened first US state trade office in China.
Both inland arid regions with energy and agricultural sectors.
Both mountainous with coal/mining. Shanxi (山西) distinct from Shaanxi.
Both tropical islands with tourism-driven economies.
Both coastal with strong educational institutions.
Zhejiang's second US partner (also NJ since 1981).
Both economic powerhouses. Jiangsu has largest provincial GDP.
Both northern cold-climate regions with forestry and agriculture.
Fujian's second US partner (also OR since 1984).
Two largest sub-national economies in their countries.
Oregon's second Chinese partner. Tianjin is a municipality.
Michigan's second Chinese partner. Guangdong's third US partner.
Friendship agreement only not full sister state.
